Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of testing on the increase in COVID-19 cases by suggesting that it is the sole cause.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the increase in COVID-19 cases by attributing it solely to testing and downplaying the concern.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the increase in cases is solely due to testing.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that increased testing is the only factor contributing to the rise in COVID-19 cases, ignoring other possible explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations for the increase in cases, such as increased transmission of the virus.
